result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela M. Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angela M. Hudson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angela M. Hudson was found guilty of Fraud/Innkeeper,etc-Nonpayment (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 20CM224

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela M. Hudson

records.addlTxt: Defendant's JOC and dismissal. Returned to Sender/Moved, Left no Address

9:11 AM Defendant Angela M. Hudson in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Angela M. Hudson.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin.  22CF72, 21CT51, 20CM224. Court quashes authorized warrants. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF72 and 20CM224. Dismiss 21CT51. Dismiss/read in Ct#3-4 in 22CF72. 2 year probation: 60 days jail, stayed, court costs ($443), AODA F/T, $1075.56 restitution in 22CF72, 1 day credit in 20cm224. Atty Nelson and Def agree. Court: def to get identification procedures completed for 22cf72. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF72 and 20CM224. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF72 and 20CM224. Dismisses 21CT51. Dismiss/read Ct#3-4 in 22CF72. DA Hatch and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court orders Ct#2 in 22CF72 and 20CM224 S/W 2 years probation; concurrent and with any other probation sentence: 60 days jail, stayed to be used at the agent's discretion, court costs ($443), $1075.56 plus 10% surcharge on 22CF72, AODA F/T, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. DOC can discharge defendant early if all conditions are met, 1 day credit on 20CM224. Provide DNA sample within 30 days.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 9:28
Defendant's Notice of Hearing(s). (10/6/2022) Return to sender. Moved left no address.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:56 PM Defendant Angela M. Hudson not in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Angela M. Hudson.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin.  22CM224, 21CT51 and 22CF72 heard at this time. DA Hatch requests a statewide warrant on each case. Atty Nelson: Def was in contact re: car accident. Requests the warrant be stayed, set a hearing soon. Court: authorizes a warrant but stays until oct 13 at 9:00.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

DA Hatch requests a statewide warrant on each case. Atty Nelson: no information on Def's whereabouts. Court authorizes a statewide warrant on each case.

Atty Nelson would like a date in front of the Judge. DE is to get mugs and prints on 22CF72 as soon as possible. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:41 pm. DA Hatch questions Officer Kober. Record reflects identification of DE. Court recess. DA Hatch is requesting Count 1 be dismissed. Court will dismiss Count 1 on 22CF72. No contact with the Radisson Hotel in River Falls WI.
Absolute sobriety.

11:32 AM Defendant Angela M. Hudson in court with Attorney Liesl Nelson.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def qualifes for PD. Court verifies address and DOB.   Court reads charges and possible penalties. DA Hatch: $10,000 signature bond w/no contact with Radisson Hotel in River Falls WI and absolute sobriety. Atty Nelson: no objection.  Court orders as requested. Court sets PH on 22CF72. 20CM224 and 21CT51 to trail. 11:39
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
